Two critical community populations who should be members of the board are COVID‐19 survivors and representatives of youth groups. The median age of the population in Africa is 19.7 years, whereas in China it is 38.4 years, and in Europe it is 43.1 years.

The younger persons in Africa could play a significant role in containment of the epidemic (the low risk of young persons to COVID‐19 may be responsible for the low incidence and prevalence of COVID‐19 in the region).
